messages.title: ME AND MY FAMILY
messages.content: Hertsmere is my home patch. I grew up around Radlett. My Dad worked in a wire factory in Watford, and my Mum still works at Boots in London Colney. I went to Parmiter's School and won a state to study law at Cambridge University. I live locally with my wife and children. My experiences have taught me the value of hard work. I believe in providing for yourself, your family and serving our community. I am honoured to have had the best of both worlds here in Hertsmere growing up in semi-rural towns and villages, and a strong sense of community that closely associates to London. As Hertsmere's MP for the past four years, I have sought to generate change and improve lives, including experiences appointing a new GP clinic and increasing our funding to our local schools. It would be an honour to be re-elected and have the opportunity to serve you again as your MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I voted Remain, but believe we should respect the outcome of the referendum. That’s why I'm backing the Prime Minister’s deal to safely leave the EU in an orderly way. Then, you and the Government can focus on the things that matter to you and your family.
My family have always used the NHS. I've helped secure the future of Potters Bar Hospital and the funding to update Watford General Hospital.
I went to great local state schools and Oxford to study law. I know the importance of high standards in education.

I commute into London and know how bad the service can be. I've helped secure Oyster for Potters Bar and Radlett, major upgrades at Borehamwood station and compensation for everyone hit by disruption, including from Bushey.
I know how concerned people are about crime, particularly burglaries in Potters Bar and Bushey.
Strong public services rely on a strong economy. I will not increase VAT, tackle the cost of living and cut taxes.
Hertsmere is a special place. We have lots of beautiful towns and countryside, but our green belt keeps getting nibbled at.

issues.brexitEurope: I voted Remain, but believe we should respect the outcome of the referendum. That’s why I'm backing the Prime Minister’s deal to safely leave the EU in an orderly way.
issues.economy: Strong public services rely on a strong economy. I will not increase VAT, tackle the cost of living and cut taxes.
issues.education: I went to great local state schools and Oxford to study law. I know the importance of high standards in education.
issues.health: My family have always used the NHS. I've helped secure the future of Potters Bar Hospital and the funding to update Watford General Hospital.
issues.lawCrime: I know how concerned people are about crime, particularly burglaries in Potters Bar and Bushey. We can tackle this and the Conservative Government will recruit 20,000 extra police officers.
issues.transport: I commute into London and know how bad the service can be. I've helped secure Oyster for Potters Bar and Radlett, major upgrades at Borehamwood station and compensation for everyone hit by disruption, including from Bushey.

community.content: Hertsmere is a special place. We have lots of beautiful towns and countryside, but our green belt keeps getting nibbled at. I know how important the green belt is. That is why, alongside the Prime Minister, I've stopped the development of a new rail terminal at Radlett airfield.

contactInformation.address: 104 High Street, London Colney, Herts, AL2 1QL
